reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a short break in Madrid for our Anniversary and would like to thanlk all at the Room Mate Alicia for making it special.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel & Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I had contacted the Alicia before we went to Organise Flowers,Cava,A Spa and a restaurant for our stay and everything was done when we arrived and all their recommendations turned out to be top class.
reviews.title: Very friendly, reliable, funky hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel itself is really cool ,the room a standard was Beautiful and great value for such an ideally situated hotel so easy to access all the sights in Madrid on foot from its excellent location.Breakfast in the tapas bar was good with a huge selection of hot and cold dishes.
reviews.title: Maybe your Room Mate but definately not our Room Mate!

likes.disliked: — The heat, smell and clautraphobic feeling.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also found the Staff at reception excellent who dealt with every query promptly and expertly.We will be back thanks to all adios.
reviews.title: Funky dunky

likes.liked: — Funky room and great spot for Prado, Reina Sofia and Thyssen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay in this hotel once or twice a month for business. It's very friendly, clean and comfortable. Reception staff are great and very friendly. The rooms are spacious (almost cavernous in fact!) and in a funky, modern, stylish design. Showers are in a stylish black ceramic tiles. Internet access (wi-fi) is excellent. It can get noisy because of the location so earplugs are a must. The breakfast is a bit annoying to go to because you have to step out into the street briefly to get to it, especially when it's cold in winter (and Madrid can get very cold), and the quality of the breakfast is not exactly gourmet, but it's adequate. All in all, this is a bit like a 4-star hotel (somewhere between 3 and 4) at 2-3 star prices. I strongly recommend the Room-mate chain in general - it's a very clever and successful formula.
reviews.title: BEST HOTEL in Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a modern, sleek, well appointed and designed hotel located at Plaza Santa Ana, an active area for night life, restaurants and touring. The desk staff were very helpful. Our outside room was designed in such a way that we had a large queen bed, a separate sitting area with a small couch and table along with a great view of the Plaza. The glass shower stall is built right into the main living area of the room which is a little unusual, but it works. The room does not have a tremendous amount of space, but it feels like it does because of the way it's designed. The room was very quiet. The breakfast, included in the room price, had a very nice selection of toasts, pastries, meats, cereals and fresh fruit compotes and coffee and teas. We were particularly impressed when on our last day there was no hot water in the morning, the hotel assured us that the hot water lapse was a fluke and discounted our entire stay by 10%. This hotel is a very good value for the money and we would recommend this property highly to anyone who did not need a very large size room.
reviews.title: A great value in a superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a 4 day stay in Madrid. The hotel was excellent. The staff were very helpful and our room was great although a bit noisy as it is right on the square but you're in Spain where no one goes to bed until 5:00 a.m.! The breakfast was super. The hotel is located in a great location and close to everything including a few minutes walk to a Metro station. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Roommate Alicia is a boutique hotel, very well located at the corner of Plaza Santa Ana, with small, well decorated rooms. The bathroom sink and shower are practically in the room with a separating door for the toilette.
reviews.title: Well located, good breakfast, noisy

likes.disliked: — Small rooms with sink and shower in the room; toilette separated by a door. Noisy on weekends.

reviews.title: fantastic hotel
reviews.text: We stayed twice in the month: the first time we had a room facing the Plaza and especially on Fri and Sat, from 1:00am-4:00am it is very noisy with car horns beeping and young people yelling and screaming, and having a jolly time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The second stay was in an interior room, no noise, but no view.
reviews.title: super stay

likes.disliked: — luggage room - someone else was walking out with OUR luggage!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location in Madrid with a stylish and cool reception area and a great room. Well worth paying the extra for a terrace as this effectively doubles the size of the room in the summer - you get a big double sun lounger and an outside shower. Only complaint would be that there was too much furniture in the room! It meant that there was less space than would have been ideal. But very much recommended.
reviews.title: Stylish hotel in great location

likes.disliked: — Huge table that completely dominated the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: We loved everything about the Room Mate Alicia. It's hard to know what to add to the positive reviews everyone else has written -- fantastic location, quiet, great breakfasts. We stayed there as a family of four, with our 13 and 10 year old daughters. The duplex suite is a great option for families. It gave everyone the privacy they needed, with the private terrace and plunge pool being a perfect way to get together. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Room Mate Alicia to anyone!
reviews.title: Fantastic choice for a family stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic modern room and lovely breakfast
reviews.title: Loved madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Location, location, location!
reviews.title: Loved Room Mate Alicia
Enjoyed very much our stay and appreciate very much help from the staff
reviews.text: This hotel is perfectly located for those that are traveling for pleasure or business in Madrid. Our stay was for pleasure and it was a family trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for three nights at the end of our honeymoon. Hotel Alicia is located in a wonderful spot, in between the Plaza Mayor and the Prado Museum. There's a cute little plaza just outside the front door with various outdoor eating/drinking options.
reviews.title: Great Place in Great Location!

likes.liked: — Room layout, private outdoor terrace, location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at Alicia were all helpful and efficient. They assisted us with picking out great restaurants, directions, etc.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at Alicia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had a free breakfast at the next door tapas bar. It included a nice spread of cheese, fruit, bread, and also eggs, bacon, and sausage.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: We loved our room. We had an executive room which included a private balcony. The room was kept very clean and used the space appropriately. There was plenty of shelf/storage space and a nice-sized bathroom. We couldn't say enough nice things about the room. (We also peeked into some of the suites as they were being cleaned and they looked great.) The whole style of Alicia is very modern.
reviews.title: Location, location, location !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hada great time at the Alicia. The hotel is excellently located and is withiin a short walk to the Plaza Mayor, Plaza Del Sol, Atocha rail station, the Prado, the Thyssen museum, The Reina Sofia and so much more. The rooms are on the small size with shower only (no bath) but are functional and clean and have modern decor and amenities (plasma TV, safe etc). The staff are very helpful and fluent in English, The guy who was on eve shifts was especially helpfull in recommending restaurants etc. Thanks. (you should go to the La Vaca Argentina which is a few blocks away and has very good steak for a decent price).
reviews.title: Perfect location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Room Mate Alicia for 2 nights from September 9-11. We booked Aerocity to pick us up from the airport since we arrived from New York very early in the morning, and were happy that we chose to set this up in advance. I emailed the hotel in advance and let them know of my early arrival. To my surprise, my room was waiting for me when I got there at 8 AM. It was nice to be able to relax for a while after an overnight flight.
reviews.title: Nice stay at the Alicia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had a room on the interior of the hotel, so although we had no view, we also had no noise, which a lot of other people mention. The shower is situated in the room (as mentioned by other reviewers) - this might be a problem if you are not 100% comfortable with your travel partner. I did not have any problem with leaking doors that some others did - it was fine. Breakfast was included and not bad. My boyfriend and I were ok with fruit and sweet rolls or toast. The waitress/hostess had a major attitude which was unexpected because the guys at the reception desk could not have been sweeter or more helpful. They were willing to go the extra mile to give you suggestions, maps, etc. The room was small but the most was made out of the space and it really had everything you could want/need in your room. It is modern / contemporary in its design. The situation of the hotel is good for lots of restaurants and an easy walk to lots of places.
reviews.title: a very good first experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were cleaned daily, and we had plenty of clean towels. My only minor compliant was the cleaning lady would leave the window open after cleaning, and there would be a sewage oder in the room that went away as soon as the window was closed.
reviews.title: A bit too much noise

likes.disliked: — The leaking shower and noise between rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I am not sure if I would visit Madrid again, however, I would not hesitate staying in another Room Mate hotel in another city.
reviews.title: Great Location & Perfect for Siesta

likes.disliked: — Leaking shower, only one computer with internet available for all hotel guests to share

reviews.title: Superb Location!!!
reviews.text: A very friendly atmosphere and a very good accomodation at all, in an excellent location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfectly adequate room for our tourist needs in exploring the city. Cracking central location on the Santa Ana square....you really don't need to go anywhere else!.... but you should!
reviews.title: Good central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were as we expected, basic and noisy at night (although we did complain at one point regarding an incredibly selfish pig0headed chap who had his window open til 4am with rave music blasting out; reception soon controlled it after our complaint!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one thing we do remember is that even though it was feb and we needed coats and scarfs of a day, it was stiflingly hot at night and the air con was rubbish!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I get the impression that you need to haggle with the hotel staff prior to your visit to get the best room with a decent non-walled- view and decent aircon, but hey, we weren't there to sit in our room, it was just for the bed!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — Some sound issues within the Building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Liked the apple instead of a choccy!
reviews.title: Good hotel, except breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great ,tidy, clean hotel.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and couldn't have been closer to the centre of Madrid.
reviews.title: Great, bright hotel in excellent location

likes.liked: — location and bright fresh design of accommodations
likes.disliked: — interior room was too warm until we opened window

reviews.title: I love Alicia!
reviews.text: Just a short walk from Sol metro station ideal for lots of bars and nice restaurants. Right!!!! back to the hotel.

reviews.title: tapas bars and museums
reviews.text: A warm welcome was given by all the staff who spoke really good english. Warm and curteous the staf fwere quick to book us in and present the key for the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was modern and clean with a safe to keep valuables, although the view from the room was of a brick wall!!!
reviews.title: Nice stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for 3 nights, 6 - 9 January 2008, having never visited Madrid before. The hotel was stylish, very comfortable and extremely central. It is on the corner of Plaza Ana within walking distance of many tourist destinations e.g. The Prada was 10 minutes away. It was also near to public transport routes and the concierge can order a taxi easily if required.
reviews.title: Loved Room Mate Alicia, Madrid

likes.liked: — Clean and comfortable, Central location, Good Breakfast, Friendly Staff
likes.disliked: — Some noise i.e furniture being moved around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very clean and warm. Occasionally it seemed a little noisy but this was because our room was above the tapas bar which also serves breakfast. (We heard furniture being moved around). Breakfasts were substantial and good.
reviews.title: Great location, good value
A friendly and beautiful hotel to stay..
reviews.text: The staff without exception were friendly and helpful and spoke good English.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel is surrounded by tapas bars and restaurants so one is almost spoilt for choice of where to eat.
reviews.title: PWL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed staying here for New Year. Great location, close to Sol, in central Madrid. The room was very clean, reasonably sized (though not huge) and had a pleasant outlook over the square. (Ask for an exterior room when booking). Breakfast served in the tapas restaurant next door and offered a good choice.The hotel is situated on one of the main "party" plazas in Madrid but the two layers of double glazing to the windows kept out the majority of noise. Booked online at roommate website and got an "early bird rate" which was 50 euros per night cheaper than standard rate. One word of warning, when we turned up, two couples were being taxied off to an alternative roommate hotel (Oscar) as Alicia had overbooked - may just have been because New Year is so busy but they may do this regularly?
reviews.title: Unbeatable Location and Great Value at the Room Mate Alicia!

likes.disliked: — Santa Ana Plaza can be quite noisy.
